title: System and Information Integrity
description: Maintaining system integrity through updates, monitoring, and protection

questions.question: Do you identify and fix system flaws promptly?
questions.context: Installing patches and updates when they're released.
questions.examples: Windows Updates, Patch Tuesday, update policy
questions.followUp: How often are updates installed? Who manages this?

questions.question: Do you have antivirus/anti-malware protection?
questions.context: Basic protection against viruses and malicious software.
questions.examples: Windows Defender, commercial antivirus, endpoint protection
questions.followUp: What antivirus do you use? On all computers?

questions.question: Do you monitor system security alerts and advisories?
questions.context: Staying aware of new threats and vulnerabilities affecting your systems.
questions.examples: Vendor bulletins, US-CERT alerts, security mailing lists, threat intelligence
questions.followUp: What security advisories do you monitor? Who reviews them? How do you act on them?
questions.discussion: Monitoring security alerts ensures awareness of new vulnerabilities and threats, enabling timely response.

questions.question: Do you update antivirus definitions regularly?
questions.context: Antivirus needs current threat information to be effective.
questions.followUp: Are updates automatic? How do you verify they're current?

questions.question: Do you perform periodic system scans?
questions.context: Regular scans catch what real-time protection might miss.
questions.examples: Weekly full scans, scheduled scans, scan reports
questions.followUp: How often do scans run? Who reviews results?

questions.question: Do you monitor your systems for attacks and indicators of compromise?
questions.context: Active monitoring detects attacks in progress and successful compromises.
questions.examples: IDS/IPS, SIEM, endpoint detection, anomaly detection, behavioral monitoring
questions.followUp: What monitoring tools do you use? Who monitors? How do you detect attacks?
questions.discussion: System monitoring detects attacks, unauthorized access, and anomalous activity indicating potential compromise.

questions.question: Do you identify and manage unauthorized software?
questions.context: Unknown or unauthorized software could be malicious or create vulnerabilities.
questions.examples: Software inventory, unauthorized software detection, removal procedures
questions.followUp: How do you detect unauthorized software? What happens when found? Any inventory?
questions.discussion: Identifying unauthorized software prevents malware persistence and reduces attack surface from unapproved applications.
